aboutpara: Stavros Vakalis is an assistant professor with the Department of Electrical Engineering, University of South Florida. He received the PhD and MSc degrees from Michigan State University, MI, USA and the Diploma degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from National Technical University of Athens, Greece. He is the recipient of multiple international fellowships and awards and first and second place in student paper competitions. His research interests include applied electromagnetics with an emphasis on wireless millimeter-wave systems for imaging, radar, sensing, and communications.

resume.description:
I'm an assistant professor with the Department of Electrical Engineering, University of South Florida. I've received a PhD and a MSc degree from Michigan State University, MI, USA and a Diploma degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from National Technical University of Athens, Greece. I'm currently a recipient of multiple international fellowships and awards and first and second place in student paper competitions. 
My research interests include applied electromagnetics with an emphasis on wireless millimeter-wave systems for imaging, radar, sensing, and communications.

experiences.bullets: 🎓Univerisity of South Florida, FL, USA | Tenure-track assistant professor with duties of teaching and research on wireless systems and sensing.
🎓Michigan State University, MI, USA | Taught “Electromagnetic Compatibility” undergraduate laboratory in both in-person and remote setting.
🏢 Verily Life Sciences, CA, USA | Worked as Wireless/RF Engineer for Life Sciences Applications

Developed the first millimeter-wave imaging system that can provide real-time imaging at 652 fps. | Experimentally demonstrated image reconstructions using non-cooperative WiFi and 5G reflections. |  Developed an N-element array technique that can perform angle estimation of O(N2 ) targets. | Designed a 5.8 GHz FMCW radar board and software for drone localization and tracking. | Theoretically derived and experimentally demonstrated coherence measurements for imaging and radar. | Worked on harmonic radar for micro-Doppler tracking of human and object motion

education.universityPara: Doctor of Philosophy, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering | CeDiD: 22VP-ZIBT-SVSL | Advisor: Jeffrey A. Nanzer, GPA: 3.86/4.0 | Thesis title: “High-Speed Millimeter-Wave Active Incoherent Fourier Domain Imaging”
Master of Science, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering | CeDiD: 20DR-YYCY-SSS8 | Advisor: Jeffrey A. Nanzer, GPA: 4.0/4.0

education.universityName: National Technical University of Athens, Greece
education.universityPara: Diploma (5-year degree), School of Electrical and Computer Engineering | Advisor: Panayiotis Cottis, GPA: 8.38/10 | Thesis title:“Real-time news gathering employing TV white spaces”
